page.title: 03 J. AND E. HALLS
page.content: J and E Halls now renamed A.P.V. Hall are this year celebrating their two hundreth year, it has been on the same site for all these years. The site is where a Tudor Palace was built for Anne of Cleves to spend her last eight years of life, Henry the eighth built it after demolishing the Priory which was on that site. In the factory is an old building known as the Priory which in fact is not a Priory but is a Gate House of the Tudor Palace. Halls have won the Queens award for one of there products called the "Hallscrew" which is a part on a fridge. The air nozzles for Concorde aircraft were produced at Hall as were the air conditioning for Buckingham Palace, The Houses of Parliament and Harrods.
